casebody.data:
FAIRES, et al.
v.
STATE BOARD OF ELECTIONS, et al. No. 84A16-1. Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 30, 2016. Deborah R. Stagner, Raleigh, for Faires, Sabra, et al. Alexander McC. Peters, Special Deputy Attorney General, for State Board of Elections, et al. Michael Crowell, Raleigh, for Faires, Sabra, et al. Stephen G. Rawson, Raleigh, for Faires, Sabra, et al. Melissa L. Trippe, Special Deputy Attorney General, for State Board of Elections, et al. Amar Majmundar, Special Deputy Attorney General, for State Board of Elections, et al. John F. Maddrey, Solicitor General, for State Board of Elections, et al. Elizabeth A. Fisher, Assistant Attorney General, for State Board of Elections, et al. Neal A. Ramee, Raleigh, for Faires, Sabra, et al. John V. Orth, for John V. Orth. The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 30th of March 2016 by John V. Orth for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief: "Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 30th of March 2016." Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i). EDMUNDS, J. recused.
